description: see http://hl7.org/fhir/json.html#schema for information about the FHIR Json Schemas

allOf.description: An action that is or was performed on a patient. This can be a physical intervention like an operation, or less invasive like counseling or hypnotherapy.

identifier.description: This records identifiers associated with this procedure that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation).

definition.description: A protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that was adhered to in whole or in part by this procedure.

basedOn.description: A reference to a resource that contains details of the request for this procedure.

partOf.description: A larger event of which this particular procedure is a component or step.

status.description: A code specifying the state of the procedure. Generally this will be in-progress or completed state.

notDone.description: Set this to true if the record is saying that the procedure was NOT performed.

notDoneReason.description: A code indicating why the procedure was not performed.

category.description: A code that classifies the procedure for searching, sorting and display purposes (e.g. "Surgical Procedure").

code.description: The specific procedure that is performed. Use text if the exact nature of the procedure cannot be coded (e.g. "Laparoscopic Appendectomy").

subject.description: The person, animal or group on which the procedure was performed.

context.description: The encounter during which the procedure was performed.

performedDateTime.description: The date(time)/period over which the procedure was performed. Allows a period to support complex procedures that span more than one date, and also allows for the length of the procedure to be captured.

performedPeriod.description: The date(time)/period over which the procedure was performed. Allows a period to support complex procedures that span more than one date, and also allows for the length of the procedure to be captured.

performer.description: Limited to 'real' people rather than equipment.

location.description: The location where the procedure actually happened.  E.g. a newborn at home, a tracheostomy at a restaurant.

reasonCode.description: The coded reason why the procedure was performed. This may be coded entity of some type, or may simply be present as text.

reasonReference.description: The condition that is the reason why the procedure was performed.

bodySite.description: Detailed and structured anatomical location information. Multiple locations are allowed - e.g. multiple punch biopsies of a lesion.

outcome.description: The outcome of the procedure - did it resolve reasons for the procedure being performed?

report.description: This could be a histology result, pathology report, surgical report, etc..

complication.description: Any complications that occurred during the procedure, or in the immediate post-performance period. These are generally tracked separately from the notes, which will typically describe the procedure itself rather than any 'post procedure' issues.

complicationDetail.description: Any complications that occurred during the procedure, or in the immediate post-performance period.

followUp.description: If the procedure required specific follow up - e.g. removal of sutures. The followup may be represented as a simple note, or could potentially be more complex in which case the CarePlan resource can be used.

note.description: Any other notes about the procedure.  E.g. the operative notes.

focalDevice.description: A device that is implanted, removed or otherwise manipulated (calibration, battery replacement, fitting a prosthesis, attaching a wound-vac, etc.) as a focal portion of the Procedure.

usedReference.description: Identifies medications, devices and any other substance used as part of the procedure.

usedCode.description: Identifies coded items that were used as part of the procedure.

allOf.description: An action that is or was performed on a patient. This can be a physical intervention like an operation, or less invasive like counseling or hypnotherapy.

actor.description: The practitioner who was involved in the procedure.

onBehalfOf.description: The organization the device or practitioner was acting on behalf of.

action.description: The kind of change that happened to the device during the procedure.

manipulated.description: The device that was manipulated (changed) during the procedure.
